name: webanno.custom.IGCoreConstitutiveComponentRelationship

features.name: Exhaustive
features.description: Indicates that relationships are exhaustive (i.e., statement does not use terms that signal open-ended relationships, such as "including", but lists all possible alternatives)

features.name: LogicalRelationship

tags.tag_description: Indicates AND relationship, i.e., conjunction. The relationship is undirected.

Describes a combination of statements, where the occurrence of the action specified in the first statement is combined with the non-occurrence of the action specified in the second statement. The relationship is directed; the target is the non-occurring action statement.
Indicates AND/OR relationship, i.e., inclusive disjunction.  The relationship is undirected.

Describes a combination of statements, where the non-occurrence of the action specified in the first statement is combined with the non-occurrence of the action specified in the second statement. The relationship is undirected.
Indicates XOR relationship, i.e., exclusive disjunction. The relationship is undirected.

features.description: Indicates type of logical relationship amongst components

features.name: PrecedenceofComponentCombinations
features.description: Indicates precedence among component relationships. Lower values imply lower precedence/priority.

features.name: Separable
features.description: Indicates whether logically-linked elements can be separated for analytical purposes, or whether they are only used in conjunction (e.g., fish and chips, Smith and Sons).

description: Captures logical relationships between institutional grammar components of the same type (e.g., multiple constituents).

name: webanno.custom.IGCoreConstitutiveSyntax

features.name: AdditionalLabels
features.description: Identifies additional custom labels. Separate labels by |.

features.name: Animacy
features.description: Animacy annotation for specific component types

features.name: Circumstance

tags.tag_description: Direction - References to directions, inclusion of intermediary locations (e.g., “via”)
Location - References to specific locations
State - References to a specific state
State Transition/Process - References a change in state or a process reflecting change in state
Indicates the beginning of a time frame
Indicates the end of a time frame
Indicates frequency expression
Point in time - References to specific points in time
Time Frame - References to time frames
Exception - Expression of exception to general rule (e.g., "unless ...")
Method - Means (e.g., artifact, tool) mediating activity
Conditions/Constraints describing the outcome or effect of an aim by an actor involved in the action situation (e.g., "Upon observing non-compliance, ...").
Origin - Identifies the context as input, e.g., based on its origin.
Procedural Order - Context specifications associated with explicit or implied execution order, i.e., performing one action depends on completion of another
Process - Reference to process specification an action needs to comply with or otherwise relates to
Purpose/Function - Conditions/Constraints describing the purpose or intent of an aim

features.description: Characterizes the circumstance of context components in constitutive statements

tag_set.name: IG Core Constitutive Components
tag_set.description: IG Core Component Annotations for Constitutive Components

tags.tag_description: Entity that is defined or modified by constitutive statement
Property associated with constituted entity

Constituting Properties capture related or constituent properties that are linked to the constituted entity via the constituting function. It is polymorphic in nature and dependent on the applied constitutive function.
Property of the Constituting Property (e.g., object property if constituting property is an object)
Functionally constitutes a Constituted Entity (with or without reference to constituting properties)
Conditions describe circumstances under which constitutive statements apply
Execution constraints describe qualifications of the constituting function
A prescriptive operator that describes whether the Aim of an institutional statement is permitted (e.g., may), obliged (e.g., shall, must), or forbidden (e.g., shall not, must not).

tag_set.name: IG Constitutive Functions
tag_set.description: Constitutive functions used in constitutive statements

tags.tag_description: Defines an entity (e.g., actor, object, role, action, policy) intensionally (e.g., "is", "counts as") or extensionally (e.g., by what it does).
Modifies entity by ascribing additional properties or features (abilities)
Annotates the creation of the constituted entity, such as object or policy (e.g., "established")
Indicates the termination of the constituted entity, such as object or policy (e.g., "terminated")
Signals that the constituted entity is composed of the elements described in constituting properties
Indicates conferral of rights or authority ("is assigned")
Indicates a purely informational statement without constitutive weight
Signals the embedding of the constituted entity in some structure (e.g., organization)
Indicates that (and how) this policy is related to another policy (e.g., "amends", "substitutes")
Signals the specification of a purpose or intent associated with the constituted entity (e.g., a policy)

features.name: Describespolicynotentity

tag_set.name: IG Constituted Policy vs Entity
tag_set.description: Includes options for annotating constituted entities as self-referential with respect to the policy characterized, an external policy (i.e., a policy outside of the regulation or initiated in the context of the regulation), or an entity/object that is affected by the regulation, respectively.

tags.tag_description: Indicates that the constituted entity is an entity/object
Indicates that the constituted entity is a policy, but not the policy of the encoded document itself (i.e., is not self-referential).
Indicates that the constituted entity is the policy itself (i.e., is self-referential).

features.description: Indicates whether this statement describes the policy it is embedded in (self-referential), as opposed to an entity/object, where the entity/object may also be a(nother) policy.

features.name: EmbedsInstitutionalStatement
features.description: Indicates whether the component is or embeds an institutional statement in its own right.

features.name: InferredComponentValue
features.description: If the component value is largely implicit (e.g., "it"), this field is filled with the explicit content the component resolves to (e.g., "the author").

features.name: PolicyRelationship

tag_set.name: IG Policy Relationships
tag_set.description: Characterize forms of policy relationships based on directionality

tags.tag_description: Policy of concern is amended by policy referred to in constituting property

tags.tag_name: Policy in constituting property is added
tags.tag_description: Policy specified in constituting property is added to policy of concern

tags.tag_name: Policy in constituting property is removed
tags.tag_description: Policy specified in constituting property is removed from policy of concern
Policy specifies in constituting property substitutes policy of concern
Policy of concern (or in constituted entity) amends policy referred to in constituting property
Policy of concern (or in constituted entity) is added to policy referred to in constituting property
Policy of concern (or in constituted entity) is removed from policy referred to in constituting property
Policy of concern (or in constituted entity) substitutes policy referred to in constituting property

features.description: Describes policy relationship between policy referred to in constituted entity and policy otherwise referred to

description: Identifies institutional statement components for constitutive statements
